alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 04 at 8:12PM PST until March 06 at 2:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 2 AM SUNDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow and strong west winds, mostly falling Saturday afternoon and evening. Plan on snow and ice covered roads Saturday night. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected. * WHERE...Above 4500 feet. * WHEN...Midnight tonight to 2 AM Sunday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...West winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts 50 mph. Be prepared for reduced visibility in blowing snow and fog. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
